item.title: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
I don’t know why but for us it was that buzzing sound through the whole word. Now thinking about it, I probably pronounced it “Yazon”. I now know how to pronounce it correctly. Not that it was so important anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive

item.title: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
item.dc:creator: Fnork
item.description:
FERGUS:

But do you men the cheap/sheep problem or the yason problem? Since if it’s the yason problem you probably have it but don’t know about it. Neither did I nor my friend or any one else in my circle of friends. First time we heard about it was when he came back.

I was referring to the latter one. I do indeed not have that problem, and so I never have. A simple trip to Wikipedia confirms that for me putting it down as “/dʒeɪsən/”. Again, I’ve never encountered anyone pronouncing it differently.

As for sheep/cheap, they are generally homophones in most accents.

Read full topic
item.source: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive

item.title: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
Fnork:

All my life I’ve never encountered anyone with that problem. Where do you live, Piteå?

But don’t get me started on Swedes trying to say “th”.

No, Östergötland, more specific in the area around Linköping.

But do you men the cheap/sheep problem or the yason problem? Since if it’s the yason problem you probably have it but don’t know about it. Neither did I nor my friend or any one else in my circle of friends. First time we heard about it was when he came back.

Read full topic

item.title: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Not good, since its so soon I’d think they’d at least have the decency to send it to earlier sign ups first.

No, they look for the results and then send it to them. I see many on the facepunch forum that have signed up on the first day and still didn’t get their key.

Read full topic

item.source: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive

item.title: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I can tell apart American voices, its just it gets bland.

That’s probably because you grew up with english. I can’t tell the spoken different between sheep/cheap but I can pronounce them correctly. It’s just when people talking about it, I’ll have to use the context to pick which one.

Most swedes, Including me, can’t pronounce Jason. One of my friends spent last summer in America with his band and they hanged out with someone named Jason and his friends. The kept commenting that my friend pronounced Jason as Yason.
This reminds me of the skyrimwiki page for Mjoll the Lioness where it says something similiar to “Although her name is pronounced Me-joll some characters ingame pronounce her name as Me-yoll.” What’s the different?

How this I turn this thread in this direction? I should probably stop now, I don’t want it to become too off topic.

Read full topic
item.source: First Look at Counter-Strike Global Offensive
